resources.string: QuizProject
That\'s the correct answer! You\'re either real smart, or real lucky."
"Oops, that's incorrect - the correct answer was: "
Here\'s your hint:
How many reindeer pull Santa\'s sleigh? (Answer in digits)
Try singing Jingle Bells to help you count them!
What has wings and sits at the top of the Christmas tree?
Angel
It has wings and a halo
How does Santa get into people\'s houses? Through the....
Chimney
He probably gets very dusty
Santa is also known as Saint â€¦ what?
Nicholas
It begins with N - give the full name
\'Dashing through the snow, on a one horse open sleigh\' is the opening line to what Christmas song?
Jingle Bells
The title has a sound in it
What kind of calendar counts down to Christmas? An ______ calendar
Advent
It begins with A
On the second day of Christmas, my true love gave me 2 what?
Turtle doves
They are a type of bird
What is the day after Christmas called?
Boxing Day
It begins with B
What star sign would baby Jesus have been?
Capricorn
It is the goat sign
What christmas plant means you have to kiss someone if you stand under it together?
Mistletoe
They have little white berries
What does santa give naughty children in their stocking?
Coal
It is black and dusty
Which country sends a big Christmas Tree to London almost every year?
Norway
It is in the North of Europe
What is the Scrooge\'s first name?
Ebenezer
It begins with E
Which country did the tradition of Christmas trees come from?
Germany
It is in Western Europe
Which christmas desserts traditionally contained meat?
Mince pies
Now they only contain raisins and other dried fruit
